story.text: __Functional reactive programming__ (__FRP__) is a [[programming paradigm]] for [[reactive programming]] ([[asynchronous programming]] [[dataflow programming]]) using the building blocks of [[functional programming]] (e.g. [[Map (higher-order function)]], [[Fold (higher-order function)]], [[Filter (higher-order function)]]). FRP has been used for programming [[graphical user interface]]s (GUIs), [[robotics]], games, and music, aiming to simplify these problems by explicitly modeling time - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Functional_reactive_programming wikipedia]

The original formulation of functional reactive programming can be found in the ICFP 97 paper Functional Reactive Animation by [[Conal Elliott]] and [[Paul Hudak]] - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Functional_reactive_programming#Formulations_of_FRP wikipedia]

FRP has taken many forms since its introduction in 1997. One axis of diversity is discrete vs. continuous semantics. Another axis is how FRP systems can be changed dynamically.
